revised_title: Observations of the Summer Solstice and the Mural Circle at the Royal Observatory
tldr: The author, John Pond, describes the observations made at the Royal Observatory during the summer solstice of 1812 using the newly erected mural circle. He explains the method of determining the north polar distance of the sun and discusses the advantages of the mural circle's design. He also mentions the uncertainty of astronomical refractions and the need for further improvements in determining the zenith point.
